column4: Hi! Any ideas why has my Ubuntu UI has become laggy after upgrading to 10.04... I initially thought it was about my video card, but I changed that yet the problem still persists. Everything was working ok and very fast on 9.04. Any ideas how to debug this?
Graphics driver, xorg configuration, stale .debs hanging around....the list goes on...
oh, and would logging in as a new user give the same result?
Graphics driver would affect two different video cards? xorg conf I've reseted. How do I detect stale .debs? And how does the list go on? :D

Firstly, upgrading usually sucks. Secondly, a way of doing the xorg reset is to literally delete (or rename) the /etc/X11/xorg.conf. Thirdly, you may have old crap in your ~/.config and ~/.cache and ~/.local that are dragging Gnome down (assuming you're running Gnome)
did xorg reset exactly like that. yup running gnome. the old crap sounds like a viable cause... how do I detect it?

I'd go through the stuff manually - get rid of crap that doesn't jive - gconf, the guts of Gnome, freaks and frogs on some of the outdated stuff - and in that case, you can even literally go so far as to rename the ~/.config and logout, login and just re-customise Gnome (and some other apps) again...have done this with a high level of success...have also gone so far as to create a new user, and just copy stuff over f

Ah, unfortunately I don't have enough knowledge to go through them manually. :) Recustomization sounds tedious... but I could try if that fixes the problem. It's safe to simply rename .config? Should I do the same for .local and .cache too?

You can always delete what's in ~/.cache/ => it's just temp stuff...however, if you want to test, just create a new user, login as that user, see what difference there is in performance...then you'll know...
thanks, I'll try that! Somehow didn't come across me to think it could be user config related.
I had the issue with a client - it ended up being Compiz, Gnome and Emerald crap that blew out the performance...
Yup, seems like my performance went up with the new user.
So I guess that means I need to clean up the gnome configs, and redo all the customizations. :( Well, there aren't _that_ many I guess.
So the simplest way to clean all gnome config is to remove .config, .local and .cache?
Oh my, even the very crappy flash video performace has become a lot better! :)
Ok...so mystery resolved.
yup, clearly. :) Thanks a lot! This has been bugging me quite a bit. :)
Just to be clear, there are no other config dirs I should be aware of, just .config .local .cache?
Right
this is working very nicely! Not even all that much I have to reconfig. Thanks again!
Yer welcome mate...enjoy...
